Shadow education secretary Andy Burnham said the report backed the views of teachers and parents who want Michael Gove to "rethink his backward-looking curriculum policy" . The Tory-chaired committee warns that Michael Gove 's plans for a narrow 1950s-style curriculum could lead to young people switching off from learning, playing up in the classroom and finding themselves unprepared for the modern workplace, he said.
